metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31625 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In PHP versions 7.4.x below 7.4.30, 8.0.x below 8.0.20, and 8.1.x below 8.1.7, when using Postgres database extension, supplying invalid parameters to the parametrized query may lead to PHP attempting to free memory using uninitialized data as pointers. This could lead to RCE vulnerability or denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.5-1ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.5-1ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.5-1ubuntu2
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.5-1ubuntu2
php8.1 - 8.1.5-1ubuntu2
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.5-1ubuntu2
php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.5-1ubuntu2
php8.1-cgi - 8.1.5-1ubuntu2

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.5-1ubuntu2').
